facts: Alfred Hitchcock was scared of... eggs. Let's all be thankful he didn't create a horror film about eggs.
Green, yellow, and red bell peppers might look like different versions of the same vegetable, but they're not!
Contrary to what you might think, Canada actually eats more macaroni and cheese than any other place. Belgium east the most fries. Germany eats the most bread.
There are more people in California than Canada, despite the fact that Canada is more than 2,000 percent larger in size than California.
Dolphins literally sleep with one eye open because only one of their brain hemispheres sleeps at a time. The left eye closes when the right half of the brain sleeps, and vice versa.
Until 2011, anything lower than 11% ABV was not legally considered alcohol.
Bees can sting other bees — usually if they feel threatened or are protecting their territory. In other words, you're not the only one who's scared of getting stung.
The heaviest onion ever grown was 18 pounds and was grown in England. That's a toddler-sized onion.
Believe it or not, wombats' poop is cube-shaped. This apparently has to do with their digestive process and various bodily contractions. The more you know.
If you put grapes in the microwave, they will explode. There are also more than 8,000 different varieties of grapes, believe it or not.

The average adult human has 2000-4000 taste buds and despite what you may have been taught, they are not visible to the human eye. Those bumps on your tongue are what the taste buds are on, but those aren't actually the taste buds themselves.
Dogs' sense of smell is 40 times more powerful than humans' — they have 300 million olfactory receptors.
Russia has more surface area than Pluto. Seem impossible? Just think of those 11 time zones.
Ketchup was once sold as medicine to treat diarrhea and indigestion. The treatment did not, in fact, work.
The Hollywood sign in Los Angeles once said 'Hollywoodland', but was changed in 1949.
White chocolate isn't actually chocolate at all. It's mostly cocoa butter, sugar, and lecithin.
SPAM actually stands for spiced ham. It's been around since 1937.
Nutmeg can be hallucinogenic if consumed in large quantities. You would have to eat at least two teaspoons or more to feel any effects, though.
Humans are the only animals on earth with chins. The scariest part is that no one knows why this is.
The Sahara Desert can reach up to 136 degrees. Its average temperature is actually about 100 degrees Fahrenheit, so it's pretty much always hot.
Pop star Lorde has an Instagram account where she rates onion rings from around the world. Because why not?
Finland has more saunas than cars. Sounds like a pretty great place. In fact, it's consistently ranked as one of the happiest countries in the world, which makes sense.
If you put together all the time of characters sitting in silence in Twilight, it would amount to 26 minutes. Vampires really are that dramatic.
Since 1962, the official sport of Maryland has been jousting.
The closest state in the United States to Africa is Maine, which juts out further east into the Atlantic than most people realize.
Volleyball and basketball were both invented in Massachusetts.
Lana del Rey's real name is Lizzy Grant. She says she chose the name because she wanted something 'that sounded sort of exotic and reminded me of like the seaside on the Floridian coast.'
Broccoli contains more protein than a lot of meats, including steak. Just another reason to add the green vegetable to your menu sometime soon.

If you play tennis at Wimbledon, swearing is not allowed. Therefore, judges have to learn swearwords in different languages in order to enforce the rules. Not the least fun job in the world, we'd say.
Mushrooms can glow in the dark. In fact, there are more than 70 varieties of mushrooms that do this. There are also 70-80 varieties of mushrooms that are poisonous to eat.
Australia is wider than the moon — 600km wider, to be exact.
Dogs have a dominant paw like humans have a dominant left or right hand. Can you tell if your dog is left-pawed or right-pawed?

Just like human babies suck their thumbs, baby elephants sometimes suck on their trunks. They can also stand within 20 minutes of birth (though they can't see for a while, and instead sense their mothers through sound and smell).
Russia has a whopping 11 time zones within the country, which gives you an idea of just how large it is.
There's an island in Japan that is only inhabited by bunnies. And, yes, you can visit there if you want.
Over the course of an average lifetime, most people will spend an entire year sitting on the toilet.
A little gross, but also kind of funny: Lobsters pee out of their faces. Even more interesting, they do this as a way to attract mates.
The Supreme Court has its own private basketball court called 'the highest court in the land.' Pretty clever, if you ask us. It also features a full gym.
Clocking in at 1,560 words, 'Rap God' by Eminem is the song with the most words. Imagine trying to memorize all of that.
Vatican City is actually the smallest country in the world at only .2 miles wide.
Jamie Lee Curtis is Jake Gyllenhaal's godmother. His parents are both directors and screenwriters, so he's always been closely connected to the industry.
Whether you realize it or not, you blink around 20 times per minute. You can blink up to 5 times per second if you try, which makes the eyes the fastest muscle in the body.
Mushrooms can glow in the dark. In fact, there are more than 70 varieties of mushrooms that do this. There are also 70-80 varieties of mushrooms that are poisonous to eat.
Carrots were originally purple, not orange. You can still find delicious purple carrots around, though, even though they're not the most popular version.
Abraham Lincoln, who was famously tall at 6'4, was also a successful competitive wrestler.
Australia is wider than the moon — 600km wider, to be exact.
The Sahara Desert can reach up to 136 degrees. Its average temperature is actually about 100 degrees Fahrenheit, so it's pretty much always hot.
The heaviest onion ever grown was 18 pounds and was grown in England. That's a toddler-sized onion.
Gatorade was invented at the University of Florida, named after the mascot of the school, the Gators. The university receives 20 percent of the profits from the beverage.
Lana del Rey's real name is Lizzy Grant. She says she chose the name because she wanted something 'that sounded sort of exotic and reminded me of like the seaside on the Floridian coast.'
On average, hair grows about 6 inches per year. As we age, some of these hair follicles stop producing hair, which is why hair loss and balding is common in older people.
Humans are the only animals on earth with chins. The scariest part is that no one knows why this is.
Pistachios are technically fruits. Think of them as the opposite of a peach. Instead of throwing out the pit and eating the flesh, we do the opposite with pistachios.
You're taller in the morning than at night. This is because over the course of the day our cartilage compresses and makes us a bit shorter.
Dogs can also breathe and smell simultaneously, unlike humans (have you ever tried to breathe while inhaling through your nose?).
Humans are the only animals on earth with chins. The scariest part is that no one knows why this is.
More people are killed by vending machines than sharks. Also, more than 90% of shark attacks are on males.
Raspberries are actually a member of the rose family. So are apples, pears, and plums.
The heart of a shrimp is located in its head. Weird, yet kind of cool. Also weird: Shrimp have an open circulatory system, so their organs just float in blood.
The oldest living animal is reportedly a Seychelles giant tortoise named Jonathan. He is 190.

Freddie Mercury has a pretty memorable smile. But did you know it's because he had four extra teeth in his upper jaw? Yup. That's why Rami Malek had to wear prosthetic teeth while working on Bohemian Rhapsody.
Most countries don't refrigerate their eggs. In the US, they are considered a perishable item and therefore have to be refrigerated, but they have a surprisingly long shelf life.
Every two weeks, another language or dialect goes extinct. There is a language in Nigeria that is currently only spoken by four living individuals.
Pop star Lorde has an Instagram account where she rates onion rings from around the world. Because why not?
Dogs can also breathe and smell simultaneously, unlike humans (have you ever tried to breathe while inhaling through your nose?).
The most expensive film ever made was Pirates of the Caribbean, which cost more than 375 million dollars to create. For reference, the average budget for a big studio movie is around $65 million.

The Sahara Desert can reach up to 136 degrees. Its average temperature is actually about 100 degrees Fahrenheit, so it's pretty much always hot.
The heaviest onion ever grown was 18 pounds and was grown in England. That's a toddler-sized onion.
Gatorade was invented at the University of Florida, named after the mascot of the school, the Gators. The university receives 20 percent of the profits from the beverage.
Australia is wider than the moon. The moon sits at 3,400 kilometers (2,113 miles) in diameter, while Australia's diameter from east to west is almost 4,000 km (2,485 miles).
Headphones can increase the bacteria in your ears. Wearing headphones for just an hour could increase the bacteria in your ears by 700 times.
Scotland chose the unicorn as its national animal. In Celtic mythology, the fictional creature is connected with both chivalry and dominance as well as purity and innocence.
Avocados are not vegetables. Avocados are fruits because they are single-seeded berries.
You probably eat bugs in your sleep. There's a good chance that we will swallow 10 spiders and 70 types of insects (or more) in the course of our lifetimes.
The Eiffel Tower gets taller in the summer. When the iron heats up, the tower can be up to 15 centimeters (6 inches) taller due to thermal expansion.
Only four words in the English language end in 'dous.' Horrendous, tremendous, hazardous, and stupendous are the four words.
Human teeth are the only part of the body that can't heal themselves. Teeth are not made of live tissue and are coated in enamel, which can't spontaneously regenerate.
Bert and Ernie's names came from a Christmas movie. The Sesame Street characters were named after Bert the police officer and Ernie the taxi driver in Frank Capra's It's a Wonderful Life.
Switzerland prohibits the ownership of just one guinea pig. Since guinea pigs are such social creatures, one guinea pig would get lonely, so having just one is considered animal abuse in Switzerland.
Tigers have striped skin. Tigers' skin is not just striped fur; the pattern goes all the way to their skin.
A shrimp's heart is in its head. Shrimp have their hearts located in their heads, and due to their open circulatory system, they have no arteries, so their organs just float around in blood.

An 11-year-old accidentally invented ice pops. In 1905, young Frank Epperson left water and soda powder outside overnight with a wooden stirrer in the cup. When he discovered the mixture had frozen, the 'Epsicle' was born.
We are more creative in the shower. The warm water increases the flow of dopamine and makes us more creative.
Sloths can hold their breath longer than dolphins. By slowing their heart rate, sloths can hold their breath for 40 minutes, while dolphins need to come up for air every 10 minutes.
Froot Loops are all the same flavor despite their different colors. Despite the different colors, all Froot Loops taste the same.
The first airplane flight was on December 17, 1903. Wilbur and Orville Wright took the first airplane on four short flights at Kitty Hawk, North Carolina.
Supermarket apples can be a year old. Farmers often pick apples in the fall, cover them in wax, hot-air dry them, and then put them in cold storage, keeping them edible for 6 to 12 months.
Most wasabi paste isn't real wasabi. Store-bought wasabi is often a substitute made from horseradish since real wasabi is expensive.
Venus is the only planet that spins clockwise. Venus rotates clockwise once every 243 days, unlike other planets that rotate counterclockwise.
People used to say 'prunes' when taking pictures. In the 1840s, it was considered childish to smile for pictures, so people said 'prunes' instead of 'cheese' to keep their mouths taut.
Nutmeg is a hallucinogen. Nutmeg contains myristicin, a natural compound that has mind-altering effects, and ingesting large quantities can cause hallucinations.
McDonald's serves spaghetti in the Philippines. McDonald's in the Philippines offers spaghetti with a side of 'McDo' fried chicken.
Competitive art was once an Olympic sport. From 1912 to 1948, artists could earn medals for painting, music, sculpture, and even architecture.

3 Musketeers candy bars used to come in three flavors. The original candy from the 1930s had three different kinds of nougat: chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry. It was later reduced to one flavor due to World War II rationing.
The Spanish national anthem has no words. The 'Marcha Real' is one of only four national anthems in the world to have no official lyrics.
Cat urine glows under a black light. Cat urine contains phosphorus, which makes it glow particularly brightly under ultraviolet light.
Before we had toilet paper, Americans used corn cobs. Before modern toilet paper, people in America used corncobs as an alternative.
'Kuchi zamishi' is Japanese for unconscious eating. It describes the act of eating when you're not hungry because your mouth is 'lonely.'
The Statue of Liberty was once a lighthouse. About a month after its dedication in 1886, the Statue of Liberty became a working lighthouse for 16 years, with its torch visible from 24 miles away.

Jennifer Lopez inspired the creation of Google images. After she wore her infamous dress at the 2000 Grammys, the search engine added the function because so many people were looking for pictures of her outfit!
British military tanks are equipped to make tea. British tank crews can make hot tea or coffee by using a boiling vessel inside the tank.
Big Ben's clock stopped at 10:07 p.m. on May 27, 2005. The clock's stopping was possibly due to the extreme heat in London that day.
You can see four states from Chicago's Willis Tower. From the top of the Willis Tower (formerly Sears Tower), you can see the states of Illinois, Michigan, Indiana, and Wisconsin.
Walt Disney has won the most Academy Awards. Walt Disney's works have won 26 Oscars and were nominated 59 times.
A blue whale's heartbeat can be heard over 2 miles away. Blue whales have enormous hearts weighing almost 400 pounds, and their heartbeat is audible from a significant distance.
There's a fruit that tastes like chocolate pudding. The fruit called black sapote, native to Central and South America, has a taste resembling sweet custard and chocolate.
Mickey and Minnie Mouse's voices got married in real life. Wayne Allwine, the voice of Mickey, and Russi Taylor, the voice of Minnie, were married in real life.
Queen Elizabeth II was a trained mechanic. As a teenager, Queen Elizabeth II learned about truck, engine, and tire repair through a British employment agency.
The real name for a hashtag is an octothorpe. The symbol '#' is also known as an octothorpe, though the origin of the word 'thorpe' is uncertain.
The Easter Island heads have bodies. Archaeologists discovered that two of the iconic stone heads on Easter Island have torsos.
Salvador Dalí designed the Chupa Chups logo. The surrealist artist Salvador Dalí created the iconic design for Chupa Chups lollipops in 1969.
M&Ms are named after its creators. The sweet treats were invented by businessmen Forrest Mars and Bruce Murrie.
Vatican City is the smallest country in the world. Vatican City is incredibly small, about 120 times smaller than Manhattan.
The letter 'J' was the last added to the English alphabet. The letter 'J' dates back to 1524. Before that, the letter 'i' was used for both 'i' and 'j' sounds.
The moon has moonquakes. Tidal stresses connected to the distance between the Earth and the moon cause moonquakes.
Ketchup used to be sold as medicine. In 1834, ketchup was prescribed as a remedy for indigestion.
You can't hum while you're pinching your nose. Try it! Humming requires air to flow through the nasal passages, which is blocked when pinching the nose.
An ostrich's eye is bigger than its brain. Ostriches have small brains compared to the size of their eyes.
The longest walking distance in the world is 14,000 miles. It's hypothetically possible to walk from Magadan in Russia to Cape Town in South Africa without using a vehicle.
Humans are the only animals that blush. Some people believe that humans may be the only animals that experience embarrassment.
Pigs can't look up into the sky. Due to the anatomy of their neck muscles and spine, pigs are unable to look upwards.
The iCarly set was also used by other high school shows. The same set used for iCarly was also used for Saved by the Bell and That's So Raven.
There are more than 200 Kit Kat flavors in Japan. Kit Kat is popular in Japan, where they create unique flavors for different cities, regions, and seasons.
Humans have tongue prints. Just like fingerprints, our tongue prints are unique to each individual.
The Eiffel Tower was supposed to be in Barcelona. Gustave Eiffel's design was originally rejected by Barcelona before it was accepted and built in Paris.
The shortest commercial flight in the world is in Scotland. The quick 1.7-mile journey between Westray and Papa Westray islands takes just 90 seconds by plane.
Dolphins give each other names. Dolphins use unique whistles to distinguish members within their pod.
There's a Shell garage that's actually shaped like a Shell. In the 1930s, Shell built a series of shell-shaped service stations, but only one remains today in North Carolina.
Ikea rugs were used for the Night's Watch cloaks in Game of Thrones. The Night's Watch cloaks in the TV series Game of Thrones were made from shaved and dyed Ikea rugs to look like medieval cloaks.
The blob of toothpaste on your toothbrush has a name (nurdle). The small amount of toothpaste applied to a toothbrush is called a 'nurdle.'
A blue whale's tongue can weigh as much as a young elephant. Blue whales have incredibly large tongues, weighing almost as much as a young elephant.
Crocodiles can't stick out their tongues. The structure of their neck muscles and spine prevents crocodiles from sticking out their tongues.
There's an ant species that's unique to New York City (ManhattAnts). Biologists found a specific ant species in New York City and named them 'ManhattAnts.'

You could fall to the center of the Earth in 19 minutes (hypothetically). Hypothetically, it would take approximately 19 minutes to fall from the surface to the center of the Earth through a tunnel or shaft.
Octopuses have three hearts. Octopuses are fascinating creatures with three hearts that pump blue blood through their bodies.
The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye. Despite the common belief, the Great Wall of China is not visible from space without aid.
Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found edible honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that is thousands of years old.
Earth has more than one moon. Earth has several natural objects that temporarily become moons due to their orbits around our planet.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not. Botanically speaking, bananas are classified as berries, while strawberries are considered aggregate fruits.
Humans share about 50% of their DNA with bananas. Although humans and bananas are vastly different, they share about half of their genetic material.
Cows have best friends and can become stressed when separated. Cows form close bonds with other cows and can experience stress when separated from their best friends.
Jupiter's Great Red Spot is a giant storm that has been raging for at least 350 years. Jupiter's iconic Great Red Spot is a massive storm that has been observed for centuries.
The world's oldest known recipe is for beer. A Sumerian poem from ancient Mesopotamia contains the oldest known recipe for brewing beer.
Armadillos can be used to detect leprosy in humans. Armadillos can carry the bacteria that cause leprosy, making them valuable in research on the disease.
The word 'nerd' was first coined by Dr. Seuss in his book 'If I Ran the Zoo.' Dr. Seuss is credited with popularizing the term 'nerd' in his book published in 1950.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance.' Flamingos are known for their vibrant pink color and are grouped together in flamboyances.
The shortest war in history lasted 38 to 45 minutes. The Anglo-Zanzibar War of 1896 is considered the shortest war ever, ending within an hour.
The largest volcano in the solar system is on Mars. Olympus Mons on Mars is the largest known volcano in the solar system, reaching heights of over 13 miles (21 kilometers).
Wombat feces are cube-shaped. Wombats produce cube-shaped droppings, which helps prevent them from rolling away.
The first computer mouse was made of wood. The prototype of the computer mouse was created by Douglas Engelbart in 1964 and was made of wood.
Maine is the closest U.S. state to Africa. From Quoddy Head State Park in Maine, you can see the easternmost point in the United States, making it the closest state to Africa.
